result.execSummary:
The defendant Shad Travis Kenneth Kindt 632942 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shad Travis Kenneth Kindt 632942 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shad Travis Kenneth Kindt 632942 was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Report to K. Kitzberger before release from Minnesota and sign up for Probation.
Court notes 211 credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
-Apply for Drug Court and if accepted complete the program successfully.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Complete all programming deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and/or the Agent.
-Cell phone held in evidence to be returned to the Defendant.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Court permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Agent.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Shad Travis Kenneth Kindt appeared from jail. Case called at 11:00 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a sentencing hearing after revocation. Both parties received a copy of the revocation packet from DOC. No corrections noted. ADA Minser recites sentencing recommendations. Atty Petros gives sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal.

Court orders: 

Bifurcated sentence. TOTAL 6 years. 3 Years I/C. 3 Years ES. 

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00

- Court costs of $268.00

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-  Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.

-  No association with known drug offenders

- Eligible CIP and SAP

- 304 days credit
Filed by Agent E. Anderson. km

records.addlTxt:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Rohan. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Shad Travis Kenneth Kindt appeared from jail. Case called at 9:56 am. ADA Minser recites agreement. Atty. Perrin confirms. DEF enters G plea to Count 1. DEF is sworn and testifies. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 16CF23. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CF23. Recess 10:02 am. On the Record 10:09 am. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
Ct 1 - Sent W/H - 3 years Probation with conditions: 
- 60 days jail STAYED
- Apply for Drug Court participation and if accepted complete program
- Report to K. Kitzberger before release from MN and sign up for Probation
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random testing
- complete all programming deemed appropriate by COMPAS and agent
- 211 days credit (does not apply against condition time)
- return of cell phone held in evidence

Adjourned 10:22 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2016 at 09:30 am.
